newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Senate passes education bill.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Senate passes education bill.

text.p: The key Independent members of the Australian Senate on Friday gave the government passage of a bill to reorganise education funding.

In general, the States Grants (Primary and Secondary Education Assistance) Bill moved federal money from public education to private schools, but made little difference to the overall level of funding.
For example, it sought to reduce funding for state schools when a student moved to a private school.
The Labor Opposition and the Australian Democrats and Greens minor parties both opposed this.
However, the government needs only two extra votes to get legislation through the upper house of parliament, and Independents Brian Harradine and Mal Colston supplied them in this case.
The government expects to depend on Harradine and Colston for some of the contentious budget-cutting measures that will come before the Senate over the coming two weeks.
Those contentious measures are worth more than A$1 billion a year to the budget.
